name: Bulgogi-Spiced Tofu Wraps with Kimchi Slaw
author: MyNutriCounter
summary: This vegetarian bulgogi-spiced wrap recipe is big on taste with its beautiful blend of spices that perfectly complement the tofu and vegetables. It's really simple to make and so satisfying that it will keep your hunger wrapped up.
ingredients: 3 cups chopped leek, or to taste
3 tablespoons chopped onion, or to taste
1 ½ tablespoons honey, or to taste
1 ½ (14 ounce) packages firm water-packed tofu, cut into 1-inch-thick slabs
1 ½ tablespoons honey, or to taste
directions: Combine 3 tablespoons soy sauce, leek, onion, 2 tablespoons sesame oil, 1 1/2 tablespoons honey, and black pepper in a bowl
Add tofu and cover with plastic wrap
Marinate in the refrigerator at least 2 hours
Whisk 1 1/2 tablespoons honey, light soy sauce, 1 1/2 tablespoons sesame oil, and gochujang together in a bowl
Toss in cucumber, carrots, daikon, and scallions
Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate slaw until ready to use
Preheat an outdoor grill to 465 degrees F (240 degrees C) and lightly oil the grate
Add the marinated tofu and grill until browned, about 4 minutes per side
Toss grilled tofu into the prepared slaw
